p: Rift Valley fever is a mosquito-borne viral disease, caused by Rift Valley fever virus (RVFV). It is a member of the Bunyaviridae family that causes abortion in ruminants, especially cattle and sheep [ 12]. The infected animal shows fever, loss of appetite, abortions, bloody diarrhea, vomiting, dullness, unsteady gait, skin necrosis on udder or scrotum, and/or death. The infected human shows mild fever, weakness, liver abnormalities, headaches, vision loss, weight loss, back pain, and may progress into inflammations of the brain [ 13].
